intro: Staberoha, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Staberoha thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long flowering season, which can extend from summer into autumn.
